title: Immport experimentsamples.elisa template schema
description: Immport experimentsamples.elisa template schema autogenerated by the CEDAR Template Editor

_ui.title: ImmPort experimentSamples.ELISA
_ui.description: The ELISA experiment sample template defines and annotates the assay results for a sample by linking sample, experiment, and results together. More than one analyte's results per assayed sample may be reported by copying the group of columns 'Analyte', 'Calculated Concentration Value', and 'Calculated Concentration Unit' needed to describe each assay result. The experiment samples template allows you to describe to ImmPort new experiments and biological samples or link experiments and biological samples stored in ImmPort with assay results. There is considerable flexibility in linking ImmPort content with new content in the templates and there are some general guidelines to remember. All of the experiment sample IDs in the template must always be unique in the template and must not already be stored in ImmPort. The biological sample and the experiment in the template may be new or they both may be new. If the biological sample or the experiment is new, then you must complete the required columns to describe them. When defining a new experiment or biological sample, it is only necessary to complete the required descriptive columns once per experiment or biological sample. The column header names in the templates indicate to what is being described and the '.xls' spreadsheet versions use color codes to indicate what is being described.

_ui.title: Experiment Sample ID
_ui.description: The experiment sample user defined ID is an identifier chosen by the data provider to refer to this sample. This ID may be referenced by other data records (e.g. assay results). The user defined ID is not shared.

_ui.title: Biological Sample ID
_ui.description: The biological sample user defined ID is an identifier chosen by the data provider to refer to a sample. This ID may be referenced by other data records (e.g. experiment sample). The user defined ID is not shared.

_ui.title: Experiment ID
_ui.description: The experiment identifier must be stored in ImmPort or in the experiments.txt template. The experiment serves as the parent entity to bind assay results of a similar type together.

_ui.title: Reagent ID(s)
_ui.description: One or more identifiers can be entered. Separate identifiers by semicolon (;). The reagent identifier(s) must be stored in ImmPort or in the reagents.txt template.

_ui.title: Treatment ID(s)
_ui.description: One or more identifiers can be entered. Separate identifiers by semicolon (;). The treatment identifier(s) must be stored in ImmPort or in the treatments.txt template.

_ui.title: Experiment Sample Name
_ui.description: The experiment sample name is a display name that is available when the data is shared, but it is not referenced by other data.

_ui.title: Experiment Sample Description
_ui.description: Describe important characteristics of the sample being assayed.

_ui.title: Additional Result File Names
_ui.description: Separate file names by a semi-colon (;). The file size name limit is 240 characters.

_ui.title: Study ID
_ui.description: An experiment and biological sample may be linked to a single study.

_ui.title: Protocol ID(s)
_ui.description: Please enter either a protocol user defined ID or ImmPort accession for a protocol that describes how the sample was derived and prepared. One or more identifiers can be entered per sample. Separate identifiers by semicolon (;).

_ui.title: Source Subject ID
_ui.description: Please enter either a subject user defined ID or ImmPort accession for the subject from which the sample was derived. A single subject record is permitted.

_ui.title: Planned Visit ID
_ui.description: The link to a study's planned visit provides temporal context for a sample's derivation from a subject.

_ui.title: Biological Sample Type
_ui.description: The sample types are adopted from Uberon, Cell and CHEBI ontologies.

_ui.title: Biological Sample Sub-Type
_ui.description: Enter a sample type that is of finer resolution than the standard sample types provided. If the 'Biological Sample Type' is 'Other', then the sample subtype must be entered.

_ui.title: Biological Sample Name
_ui.description: The biological sample name is a display name that is available when the data is shared, but it is not referenced by other data.

_ui.title: Biological Sample Description
_ui.description: The biological sample description is used to describe details of the sample not captured in other columns.

_ui.title: Study Time Collected
_ui.description: Study time collected describes the time value for when a sample was derived from a subject.

_ui.title: Study Time Collected Unit
_ui.description: The time units are standard terms recommended by the HIPC Standards group.

_ui.title: Study Time T0 Event
_ui.description: The time zero event refers to the study milestone upon which time is based.

_ui.title: Study Time T0 Event Specify
_ui.description: Enter a time zero event if 'Other' is selected in column 'Study Time T0 Event'.

_ui.title: Experiment Name
_ui.description: The experiment name is a display name that is available when the data is shared, but it is not referenced by other data.

_ui.title: Description
_ui.description: The experiment description is used to describe details of the experiment not captured in other columns.

_ui.title: Experiment Purpose
_ui.description: The experiment purpose describes the nature of the data that will be collected.

_ui.title: Measurement Technique
_ui.description: The measurement technique describes the assay method.

_ui.title: Result Separator Column
_ui.description: This pseudo column separates meta data from results.

_ui.title: Analyte
_ui.description: The analyte describes what is being measured in an assay. Please select a name from the list provided if the name matches your name or enter a name if there is not an appropriate one provided. This name is visible when the result is shared.

_ui.title: Calculated Concentration Value
_ui.description: The analyte's concentration value.

_ui.title: Calculated Concentration Unit
_ui.description: The analyte's concentration unit.

_ui.title: Comments
_ui.description: Comments captures additional descriptive information that is added to the result.
